foods.rationale: Easy to digest complex carbohydrate for sustained energy during the first workout.
foods.israel_alternative: Kashi Instant Oats (שיבולת שועל אינסטנט קוואקר)

foods.rationale: Quick-digesting carbohydrates and potassium to prevent cramps.
Additional simple carbohydrates for immediate energy.
Provides carbohydrates for sustained energy and electrolytes (sodium, potassium) to replace losses during prolonged moderate intensity exercise, preventing dehydration and maintaining performance.
foods.israel_alternative: Isostar Hydrate & Perform (איזוסטאר משקה איזוטוני) or homemade mix (water, sugar, salt)

foods.rationale: Provides both protein for muscle repair and carbohydrates for glycogen replenishment, along with fluids and electrolytes. Excellent recovery drink.
Quick-digesting carbohydrates to initiate immediate glycogen replenishment after intense exercise.
Rapidly absorbed protein to maximize muscle protein synthesis and repair post-workout.
foods.israel_alternative: Whey Protein Powder (אבקת חלבון מי גבינה)

foods.rationale: Complex carbohydrate source for sustained energy and continued glycogen replenishment.
Lean protein for muscle repair and satiety.
Provides vitamins, minerals, and fiber for overall health and digestion.
Source of healthy monounsaturated fats.
More complex carbohydrates for sustained energy.
Healthy fats and protein for satiety and energy.
Fiber, vitamins, and natural sugars.
Excellent source of complex carbohydrates and vitamins, aiding in glycogen replenishment and recovery.
High-quality protein and omega-3 fatty acids for muscle repair and anti-inflammatory benefits.
Provides essential vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
Adds flavor and healthy fats.
Slow-digesting casein protein for overnight muscle recovery and repair.
foods.israel_alternative: Plain Greek Yogurt (יוגורט יווני טבעי 0% שומן)

foods.rationale: Antioxidants and natural sugars.

response.sodium_note: The sodium target of 4000mg is challenging to meet with whole foods alone without excessive salt use. Athletes often supplement with electrolyte drinks/tablets during and after intense training to achieve higher sodium intake. This plan focuses on moderate sodium from food sources. Consider adding an additional 1500-2000mg through electrolyte supplements or by lightly salting meals to taste, especially post-workout.

meals.timing_notes: Consumed 60 minutes before the first workout for optimal digestion and energy availability.
meals.rationale: Provides easily digestible carbohydrates for immediate energy for the first workout. Low in fat and protein to prevent gastrointestinal distress. Includes electrolytes for pre-hydration.

israel_alternatives.electrolyte_drink: משקה איזוטוני מקומי (e.g., Powerade, Gatorade, or local brands like Golda's isotonic drinks)

foods.food_item: Energy Gel (e.g., SIS GO Isotonic Gel)

meals.rationale: Provides rapid-absorbing carbohydrates to sustain energy levels during the run and prevent glycogen depletion, especially important with a second workout soon after.

israel_alternatives.energy_gel: ג'ל אנרגיה (e.g., 32Gi, Maurten, or local sports nutrition stores)

meals.timing_notes: Consumed immediately after the second workout to kickstart recovery and replenish glycogen stores.
meals.rationale: High in rapidly digestible carbohydrates and protein to maximize glycogen replenishment and muscle protein synthesis after two workouts. Sodium aids rehydration.

israel_alternatives.whey_protein_isolate: אבקת חלבון מי גבינה (Available at local supplement stores)

meals.timing_notes: A well-balanced meal to continue recovery and provide sustained energy.
meals.rationale: Provides complex carbohydrates for sustained energy, lean protein for muscle repair, and healthy fats. Vegetables contribute micronutrients.

meals.timing_notes: Bridge between lunch and dinner, preventing hunger and providing a carb boost.
meals.rationale: Combines protein for satiety and muscle support with carbohydrates for energy. Rice cakes offer a quick, easily digestible carb source.

israel_alternatives.rice_cakes: פצפוצי אורז (Pitzputzei Orez) or לחמית אורז (Lachmit Orez)

meals.timing_notes: Balanced meal to further replenish glycogen and provide nutrients for overnight recovery.
meals.rationale: Complex carbohydrates for sustained energy release, lean protein from salmon for muscle repair, and healthy fats (omega-3s) for overall health and inflammation reduction. Vegetables for micronutrients.

meals.timing_notes: Final meal before bed to provide slow-digesting protein for overnight muscle repair and additional carbs if needed.
meals.rationale: Cottage cheese provides casein, a slow-digesting protein, for sustained amino acid release during sleep, aiding muscle recovery. Whole wheat bread adds complex carbs.

response.notes: This is a sample meal plan and may need to be adjusted based on individual needs and preferences. Prioritize whole, unprocessed foods. Ensure adequate hydration throughout the day. Sodium adjusted to target. Macros adjusted to target. As protein is over target, carbs and fat have been lowered. Sodium is less than target, consider adding salt to taste. Consult with a registered dietitian or sports nutritionist for personalized guidance.

meal_plan.rationale: Provides easily digestible carbohydrates for fuel before the morning workouts. The banana offers potassium, important for electrolyte balance.  Oatmeal is a good source of sustained energy.

foods.israel_alternative: Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard Whey (available in Israel)
Glucose powder (available in pharmacies in Israel)

meal_plan.rationale: Replenishes glycogen stores and provides protein for muscle recovery immediately after the workout. Dextrose is chosen for its fast absorption rate. Sodium helps with rehydration and electrolyte balance.

foods.israel_alternative: Kikkoman Low Sodium Soy Sauce (available in Israel)

meal_plan.rationale: Provides a balanced meal with lean protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats. Brown rice offers sustained energy. Broccoli provides essential vitamins and minerals. Low sodium soy sauce adds flavor.

foods.israel_alternative: Lechem Erez Whole Wheat Bread (available in Israel)

meal_plan.rationale: Provides a combination of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats to help maintain energy levels and satiety between lunch and dinner. Avocado provides monounsaturated fats, beneficial for heart health.

Provides high-quality protein, complex carbohydrates, and omega-3 fatty acids. Salmon is a great source of omega-3s, important for reducing inflammation and supporting overall health. Sweet potato offers a good source of vitamin A and fiber.
Provides a slow-digesting protein source (casein in Greek yogurt) to aid in muscle recovery overnight. Berries offer antioxidants. Almonds contribute healthy fats and fiber.

response.notes: This meal plan is a sample and should be adjusted based on individual needs and preferences. Sodium needs to be increased to 4000mg daily. This can be accomplished either by adding salt to meals (being careful to measure) or by drinking electrolyte drinks. Calorie and macro targets were met. Be sure to drink plenty of water throughout the day, especially around workouts. Consider adding a multivitamin to ensure adequate micronutrient intake. Consult with a registered dietitian or sports nutritionist for personalized guidance.
